last_episode_to_air.name: Najeonchilgi (Wonju)
last_episode_to_air.overview: At their final destination, the trio starts off the day by collecting toxic tree sap as they explore the intricate craft of najeonchilgi.

name: Korea No.1
overview: Yu Jae-seok, Lee Kwang-soo and Kim Yeon-koung travel all over Korea to learn from the best traditional masters in a bid to become the No. 1 Apprentice.

episodes.name: Jang (Damyang)
episodes.overview: Under the hot sun, the trio have their work cut out for them as they try making jang — staple ingredients of the Korean kitchen. Can they take the heat?

episodes.name: Getbol (Shinan)
episodes.overview: At Shinan’s majestic tidal flats, the hosts try hunting octopuses with their bare hands while struggling to keep themselves from sinking into the mud.

episodes.name: Mosi (Seocheon)
episodes.overview: Kwang-soo eyes the day’s Number One title while learning to weave hansan mosi from scratch. But making fabric out of plant fibers is no easy feat!

episodes.name: Jukbangryeom Anchovy (Namhae)
episodes.overview: The trio attempts to catch anchovies using jukbangryeom, a method dating back nearly 600 years. They'll need to work quickly before the tide comes in.

episodes.name: Jjock (Naju)
episodes.overview: The hosts arrive at a jjock field in Naju, where they uncover the fascinating secret to extracting blue pigment from green indigo leaves.

episodes.name: Makgeolli (Busan)
episodes.overview: At a 500-year-old brewery in Busan, the three learn to make makgeolli the traditional way. Surprisingly it involves a great deal of spinning in place.

episodes.name: Najeonchilgi (Wonju)
episodes.overview: At their final destination, the trio starts off the day by collecting toxic tree sap as they explore the intricate craft of najeonchilgi.
